entry.title: game-icons.net
entry.content:
Here’s a handy resource that I will be sure to use in the future: game-icons.net.

The site has thousands of icons available under a CC by 3.0 license. I am not a lawyer, but by my read this means you can reuse, redistribute, and remix the icons provided you give appropriate credit, indicate if changes were made, and provide a link to the license.

Check the site out and tweet me if you use or have used the icons in your game.

entry.title: Peter Venkman FATE example character
entry.content:
I made a sample character so players would get a handle for the FATE system. I’m using FATE Accelerated to run a Ghostbusters International-inspired game.

Womanizing failed psychiatrist cofounder of the original Ghostbusters

entry.title: Using Google Docs for mock-ups
entry.content:
Google Docs is great for mock-ups. But one major drawback is that Google Drawings doesn’t support animation or multiple pages. Luckily, the same suite of tools is available in Google’s Slides app.

My workflow

Since I’m not a big fan of the cluttered Slides interface, I sketch my mock-ups in Draw and copy them over to Slides.

Using this approach, I rapidly iterate on mock-ups in Draw while keeping a record of the good looking ones as slides in Slides. As a bonus, I can then shuffle the order of the slides to animate dynamic designs.

I find that this workflow is in keeping with Draplin Design Co. owner Aaron Draplin’s design philosophy: space is cheap, so feel free to experiment and keep everything because you never know what will influence the final design.
